intro: Ligularia pubifolia, commonly known as the hairy ligularia, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant produces showy yellow-orange flowers arranged in a flat-topped cluster, which bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for wetland gardens and bog landscapes.
